subject: Cybersecurity
title: Disinformation Campaigns: Hacking Minds, Not Machines
description: A 60-second lesson on Disinformation Campaigns: Hacking Minds, Not Machines.

hook.text: Why hack a voting machine when you can hack the voters' minds through social media?

buildup.text: Information warfare uses fake news, bots, and manipulated content to influence public opinion and sow division.

discovery.text: Russia's Internet Research Agency ran thousands of fake American social media accounts to amplify political divisions.

twist.text: Both sides of every debate were targeted. The goal wasn't to pick a winner ‚Äì it was to make everyone.

climax.text: Information warfare is cheaper than conventional warfare and harder to attribute. It's the perfect asymmetric weapon.

punchline.text: The best weapon isn't a virus. It's a believable lie.

quiz.question: What was the primary goal of Russia's social media disinformation campaigns?
options: To amplify divisions and erode trust in institutions
